docs.lead_paragraph: Spain’s first female defense minister, whose pregnancy became a symbol of Spain’s new commitment to sexual equality, began maternity leave after giving birth to a boy.

headline.main: Spain’s Defense Minister Becomes a Mother
headline.print_headline: Spain’s Defense Minister Becomes a Mother

docs.snippet: Spain’s first female defense minister, whose pregnancy became a symbol of Spain’s new commitment to sexual equality, began maternity leave after giving birth to a boy.

docs.lead_paragraph: This week, a complex and controversial piece of legislation began to make its way through the British parliament. One of the provisions of the bill permits the creation of "savior siblings" - children created via in vitro fertilization (I.V.F.) to ensure their tissues will match those of a sick older brother or sister, in order that the new child could provide, say, a bone marrow transplant. (Conceiving a child the old-fashioned way doesn't guarantee a tissue match.) Another is a reduction of the legal time-limit on abortion, which up to now has been 24 weeks.
docs.abstract: In Britain, a controversial proposal to allow the merging of the DNA of two separate species.
docs.snippet: In Britain, a controversial proposal to allow the merging of the DNA of two separate species.

docs.lead_paragraph: 10 P.M. (Cinemax) YOU KILL ME (2007) Ben Kingsley, left, plays a boozy hit man from Buffalo who is sent to dry out in San Francisco, where he acquires an A.A. sponsor (Luke Wilson), a job sprucing up corpses at a funeral home and a mouthy girlfriend (Téa Leoni). Now he's about to return home to settle some scores, and he's got help. Writing in The New York Times, Manohla Dargis extolled Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely's ''rudely funny script'' and said that this film from John Dahl ''goes about as dark as a comedy can go before turning into tragedy or self-parody.'' 8 P.M. (Fox) COPS Dumb and dumber: ''Stupid Criminals Special Edition 4.'' At 9 ''America's Most Wanted: America Fights Back'' reveals its 1,000th capture: Dwight Smith, the Manhattan real estate agent and murder suspect.

docs.abstract: By Bob Powers Lefty broadsider Michael Moore just completed a deal for a sequel to his 2004 film about the Bush administration's war on terror, "Fahrenheit 9/11." The original film was the highest-grossing domestic release of a documentary ever, but his follow-up, "Sicko," barely made a dime at the box office. It's expected that the [...]

docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities can remove newborns in all but an “extraordinary instance” if the parents previously had children taken from their custody and their case is still open.

docs.lead_paragraph: A draft report says that there is no scientific evidence that synthetic turf fields in New York pose major health hazards for people playing on them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Much has been written about contractors from hell, but comparatively little attention is paid to the homeowner from hell, who can make contractors crazy.
